headline.main: An Insidious Poison Lurks in Some Fish

docs.lead_paragraph: IT seems terribly unfair when people are careful to select health-promoting foods and then get sick from eating them. That was the fate of a Massachusetts couple, Dr. and Mrs. Richard Berlin of Pittsfield, who became mysteriously ill after dining on red snapper while vacationing in South Florida. It took six months and numerous visits to the doctor before the true cause of their strange symptoms was uncovered through persistent sleuthing by the ill physician.
